Algol 58/60

Paul McJones has been curating ALGOL section of Software Preservation Group. He notes:

I recently created an ALGOL section at the Computer History Museumâ€™s Software Preservation Group web site, covering the language standardization efforts â€” for ALGOL 58 (also known as the International Algebraic Language), ALGOL 60, and ALGOL 68 â€” and also covering many implementations, dialects, and offshoots, complete with source code, manuals, and papers for many of these. The history of ALGOL has attracted many writers, and the final section of the web site links to many of their papers.

Also see his follow up blog about Whetstone ALGOL.
